rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:6
rsbNotes.text: 26:6 drinks violence. Or, “suffers violence.” Sending a fool on an errand is asking for trouble.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:7
rsbNotes.text: 26:7 A wisdom saying uttered by a fool is so incongruous with his character that it loses power.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 26:8
rsbNotes.text: 26:8 The absurdity of preventing a stone from leaving the sling illustrates the absurdity of honoring the fool.
